author: jwoolley
msg: Fix a potential segfault on Unix when apr_file_close() is called and the
file_cleanup fails.  Previously in that situation the cleanup would not
be deregistered and therefore it would get run again when the pool went
away.  Similar behavior in the directory cleanup logic caused segfaults
at some point in the past.
Reviewed by:	Ryan Bloom, Bill Rowe

author: bjh
msg: Add unix mktemp to OS/2 build.

author: rbb
msg: This structure needs a pool, or the pool accessors will fail

author: rbb
msg: Make sure we declare the pool accessor for both kinds of rwlocks

author: rbb
msg: Implement pool accessors for thread_condition variables.
